text: Hello everyone, I started experimenting with the Julia language. For fun, I translated some X-ray pulsar search functionality from Python to Julia. The repo is here: <https://github.com/matteobachetti/psrsearch.jl>. Is there interest for this kind of code in JuliaAstro?

elements.text: Hello everyone, I started experimenting with the Julia language. For fun, I translated some X-ray pulsar search functionality from Python to Julia. The repo is here:
. Is there interest for this kind of code in JuliaAstro?

text: ciao and welcome :slightly_smiling_face:  if you'd like to move the repo under JuliaAstro organisation I can send you the invite!

elements.text: ciao and welcome
if you'd like to move the repo under JuliaAstro organisation I can send you the invite!

text: Sure

elements.text: Sure

text: sent!  can I ask you how do you like Julia in your short experience? :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: sent!  can I ask you how do you like Julia in your short experience?

text: Nice, setting everything up (docs, tests) was quite easy

elements.text: Nice, setting everything up (docs, tests) was quite easy

text: yeah, sure, sorry.  I don't get why github doesn't keep them for transferred repositories :disappointed:

text: I hope you don't mind the pull requests I opened with some suggestions :grin:

text: Don't mind at all, actually very informative! I think there are a couple of things to fix in the revised algorithm though, if I'm not mistaken your version has a sum of squares instead of the square of sums. I'll check later when I'm more awake :D

elements.text: Don't mind at all, actually very informative! I think there are a couple of things to fix in the revised algorithm though, if I'm not mistaken your version has a sum of squares instead of the square of sums. I'll check later when I'm more awake :D

text: Never mind, your benchmark had a different calculation, but the actual code was correct! Thanks!

text: so, after you merge <https://github.com/JuliaAstro/PulsarSearch.jl/pull/16>, you can trigger again registration as you did before (leave a comment on the commit in `main`).  the pull request <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/30552> will be automatically updated.  with these changes,  automerge should be happy
